de.polygonal.ds.ArrayUtil

type
class

Various utility functions for working with arrays.

Static Methods

inline alloc<T>(x : Int) : Array<alloc.T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x < 0 (debug only).
Allocates an array with a length of x.

inline assign<T>(dst : Array<assign.T>, C : Class<assign.T>, ?args : Array<Dynamic>, ?k : Int) : Void

parameters
k the number of elements to put into dst. If omitted k is set to dst.length;
Sets up to k elements in dst to the object of type C.

bsearchComparator<T>(a : Array<bsearchComparator.T>, x : bsearchComparator.T, min : Int, max : Int, comparator : bsearchComparator.T -> bsearchComparator.T -> Int) : Int

returns
the index of the element x or the bitwise complement (~) of the index where x would be inserted (guaranteed to be a negative number). The insertion point is only valid for min=0 and max=a.length-1.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError a/comparator is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid min/max search boundaries (debug only).
Searches the sorted array a for the element x in the range (min, max] using the binary search algorithm.

inline bsearchFloat(a : Array<Float>, x : Float, min : Int, max : Int) : Int

returns
the index of the element x or the bitwise complement (~) of the index where x would be inserted (guaranteed to be a negative number). The insertion point is only valid for min=0 and max=a.length-1.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError a is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid min/max search boundaries (debug only).
Searches the sorted array a for the element x in the range (min, max] using the binary search algorithm.

inline bsearchInt(a : Array<Int>, x : Int, min : Int, max : Int) : Int

returns
the index of the element x or the bitwise complement (~) of the index where x would be inserted (guaranteed to be a negative number).
The insertion point is only valid for min=0 and max=a.length-1.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError a is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid min/max search boundaries (debug only).
Searches the sorted array a for the element x in the range (min, max] using the binary search algorithm.

inline copy<T>(src : Array<copy.T>, dst : Array<copy.T>, ?min : Int, ?max : Int) : Array<copy.T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError src is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError dst is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Copies elements in the range [min, max] from src to dst.

equals<T>(a : Array<equals.T>, b : Array<equals.T>) : Bool

inline fill<T>(dst : Array<fill.T>, x : fill.T, ?k : Int) : Void

parameters
k the number of elements to put into dst. If omitted k is set to dst.length;
Sets up to k elements in dst to the instance x.

inline memmove<T>(a : Array<memmove.T>, destination : Int, source : Int, n : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid destination, source or n value (debug only).
see
ttp://www.cplusplus.com/reference/clibrary/cstring/memmove/
Copies n elements inside a from the location pointed by the index source to the location pointed by the index destination.
Copying takes place as if an intermediate buffer is used, allowing the destination and source to overlap.

quickPerm(n : Int) : Array<Array<Int>>

parameters
n number of elements to permute.
see
http://www.freewebs.com/permute/quickperm.html
A counting quick permutation algorithm.

inline shrink<T>(a : Array<shrink.T>, x : Int) : Array<shrink.T>

Shrinks the array to the size x and returns the modified array.

shuffle<T>(a : Array<shuffle.T>, ?rval : Array<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval a list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive) defining the new positions of the elements. If omitted, random values are generated on-the-fly by calling Math.random().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError insufficient random values (debug only).
Shuffles the elements of the array a by using the Fisher-Yates algorithm.

sortRange(a : Array<Float>, compare : Float -> Float -> Int, useInsertionSort : Bool, first : Int, count : Int) : Void

parameters
compare a comparison function.
useInsertionSort if true, the array is sorted using the insertion sort algorithm. This is faster for nearly sorted lists.
first sort start index. The default value is 0.
count the number of elements to sort (range: [first, first + count]).
If omitted, count is set to size().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError first or count out of bound (debug only).
Sorts the elements of the array a by using the quick sort algorithm.

split<T>(a : Array<split.T>, n : Int, k : Int) : Array<Array<split.T>>

throws
de.polygonal.AssertError n is not a multiple of k (debug only).
Splits the input array a storing n elements into smaller chunks, each containing k elements.
